lead_paragraph: For those who are still wondering what all the hoopla surrounding the planned Google-DoubleClick merger is about, Google has chosen to explain. The essay posted on Google’s official blog is, of course, a bit self-serving, as it is a description of how the merger, if it goes through, will benefit everyone from online advertisers to publishers and consumers. In particular, there is no mention of the antitrust concerns raised by some companies, which are currently being reviewed by the Federal Trade Commission, or of the potential privacy pitfalls brought up by some advocacy groups.

headline.main: The Ad World According to Google
